qoute1: Always give without remembering and always receive without forgetting.
qoute2: No one has ever become poor from giving
qoute3: Happiness doesn’t result from what we get, but from what we give.
qoute4: We make a living by what we get. We make a life by what we give.
qoute5: Remember that the happiest people are not those getting more, but those giving more.
qoute6: The meaning of life is to find your gift. The purpose of life is to give it away.
qoute7: Those who are happiest are those who do the most for others.
qoute8: Service to others is the rent you pay for your room here on earth.
qoute9: Everyone can be great because everyone can serve.
qoute10: As we work to create light for others, we naturally light our own way.
campaigns_and_posts_from_your_favorite_s: Campaigns and posts from your favorite schools.
donated_qoute1: Think of giving not as a duty, but as a privilege.
donated_qoute2: No act of kindness, no matter how small, is ever wasted.
walkthrough_title_1: It’s difficult to afford school supplies
walkthrough_title_2: Lets stop children's from being late to early childhood education
walkthrough_title_3: Lets help students who live in poverty.
walkthrough_description_1: From items that immediately come to mind (pencils, paper, binders) to those that are less obvious yet no less crucial (tissues, hand sanitizer), the back-to-school season calls for a whole lot of shopping.
walkthrough_description_2: Sometimes, kids from poorer families can miss out on some of the basic development in their very early years that helps to set them on the path to success when they actually start school
walkthrough_description_3: without access to early childhood literacy, kids might not get the chance to sound out letters for themselves.
